newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China's Henan Binxiong wins OK to offer A shares.
newsitem.headline: China's Henan Binxiong wins OK to offer A shares.

text.p: Henan Binxionng Co Ltd has won approval from the China Securities Regulatory Commission to offer 18 million class A shares in Shanghai, the China Securities Bulletin reported on Wednesday.
The offer, priced at 5.18 yuan per share, would be launched via the Shanghai bourse's automated quotation system on September 16, the bulletin quoted a company spokesman as saying.
China Southern Securities was the chief underwriter.
Binxiong, which produces refrigerators and refrigerated containers, has also received approval to simultaneously issue two million staff shares, the Bulletin said.
The staff shares would not be floated until six months after the listing of the A shares for domestic investors, tentatively set for September 30.
Binxiong has total share capital of 60 million state shares and would use proceeds to expand its core business and upgrade production facilities.

Based in the city of Shangqiu in central China's Henan province, Binxiong has forecast after-tax profits of 27.00 million yuan for 1996 against 21.65 million yuan posted last year and 15.82 million yuan in 1994.
